description: Triangle of second-to-last man to survive in Josephus problem of n men in a circle with every k-th killed, with k<=n.
references: Ball, W. W. R. and Coxeter, H. S.M. Mathematical Recreations and Essays, 13th ed. New York: Dover, pp. 32-36, 1987.
Kraitchik, M.; "Josephus' Problem", Sec. 3.13 in Mathematical Recreations. New York: W. W. Norton, pp. 93-94, 1942.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Josephus Problem.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
